meanings.definition: Thrown upward or in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The upthrown ball soared high into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The kite was upthrown by the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The upthrown balloon surprised the children as it floated away.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits felt upthrown after receiving the good news.
meanings.sent5: The upthrown leaves danced in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: He upthrown the rock to see how far it would go.
meanings.sent2: She upthrown the paper airplane across the room.
meanings.sent3: The chef upthrown the pizza dough in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The idea was upthrown into the conversation, sparking a lively debate.
meanings.sent5: The athlete upthrown the javelin with great strength.
